features: 【Heavy-Duty Camera Tripod】Our camera tripods are made of high-quality aluminum alloy to increase the tripod's strength and corrosion resistance, etc. A hanging hook for added stability and non-slip rubber feet swivel on a ball joint, making it easier to get stability on slopes and uneven surfaces. Heavy-duty tripod keeps your camera and devices safe.

【Adjustable Tall Tripod】Aluminum tripod 4-section legs with locking clips make this tall tripod from 21.5" to 75" as you need it, ideal for people of different heights and needs. Max load up to 13 lbs, lightweight travel tripod weighs just 2.9 lbs. Wherever you want it to be, the camera tripod will help you record the wonderful view.

【Versatile & Functional Tripod】Our Tripod for cameras with a standard 1/4" quick release plate, which is compatible with most cameras such as Canon, Nikon, Sony, Olympus, Fuji, digital cameras, etc. And laser levels, projector, webcam, and spotting scopes. Phone tripod with a 360° rotating phone holder mount that fits most cellphones, compatible with iPhone 14 13 12 11 Pro/XS/XR/MAX/8/8 Plus, Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra S22 S21 /S10/S9 /S8...

【Professional Camera Tripod】Camera tripod stand with pan head and handle, can 360° degrees rotation, 180° up and down, and 90°vertical portrait shooting to allow for tilt and swivel motion and adjusts to multiple shooting angles in only a few seconds. Camera tripod stand can meet all the Angle needs.

【 Wide Use】For some tall people, get the camera close to your eye level without excessive stooping. The tall tripod can suit more people of different heights and shoot some special scenes, such as wedding scenes, sports meets, concerts, etc, leaving precious pictures.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this multifunctional tripod
reviews.reviewText: The color is cool and I like standing out from the other photographs especially if you leave your camera equipment out for long exposure shots. There's a mono pod too as the frame lifts up. Very cool feature. Small and lightweight to carry when folded up. Doesn't take long to setup and is very durable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tripod for the money
reviews.reviewText: This is a surprisingly sturdy tripod for the money. It is very stable with lots of head adjustments. The feet are flexible so that they are always sitting flat. The tripod has a good weight to it which would make it ideal for outside with wind. In addition it has a hook for an additional weight to increase stability. Although given the weight I wouldn't recommend for a travel tripod where you have to walk great distances. The head has a large number of adjustment knobs to obtain any angle you need. I really like that it allows you to go from portrait to landscape orientation with the turn of a knob. Also the head will unscrew and it easily becomes a monopod. It also comes with an extra quick release plate which is very nice in case you loose one or want one for more than one camera. It comes with a cell phone holder and carry bag as well. Everything fits in the bag. The cell phone holder is adjustable and will hold at least a Samsung S9+ size (see photo). The tripod has a handle that makes it easy to carry. I included a picture of the box with the specs for the tripod. It does come with directions although using it was easy to figure out if you have used tripods before. Finally, I have to add that I bought the blue one and love the color.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent bang for your buck, sturdy and versatile tripod
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This thing is quite nice if you're looking for a tripod that can do a lot more than you expect. Sure you can use part of it as a trekking pole but the point of this is to have something that is sturdy yet light and adaptable to various environments and uses. This tripod does just that.My old tripod was much more simple with only telescoping legs at 1 level and it was time consuming to do. For this one you just flip the cover up and telescope up or down and lock it back into place.If you want to be more mobile and hands on, you can release the monopod and take a single pole with you. It's great for resting the pole on a nearby surface or fully telescope to account for standing. To see it in action, please see my video demonstration.It comes with a nice compact travel bag with shoulder strap. See picture.

reviews.reviewText: Tripod works well. Feels strong and sturdy.I put a spotting scope on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This tripod for the price is top notch. Have used it 100 times with no issues

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars rugged & heavy duty needs
reviews.reviewText: after trying 3 other tripods considered selfie stick tripods comparable in height, all made incredibly cheaply or even on one case so dangerous i was cut immediately, THIS tripod sets them all apart!first this is not a selfie stock tripod, it's a proper photographer videographer tripod that can handle any weight you throw at it & has a hook to add more weight if you need it.it's built well, it's heavy duty & heavier than cheaply made tripods for sure but for what it does, it's lightweight yet doesn't feel that way when using it.the moving foot pedals alone! there are levels to check straightness & such, every possible adjustment one could need, comes with a carrying case & instructions. a cellphone holder adapter & extra shoe for cameras with screw holes.easy to unbox & set up, easy to use for anyone familiar with original tripods, safer so far too! there are plenty of other videos showing the product so I don't feel adding another is helpful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For the price, you can't beat it! Sturdy, lightweight, and had many features.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Light-weight Tripod / Monopod for the Money....
reviews.reviewText: Since I don't use a tripod all that often, I didn't want to spend a ton of money on one. Truth be told, I originally was looking at a monopod to use to help stabilize things when using a telephoto for a long time. This does the trick....the mono unit fits right in the middle and can easily be separated from the base unit...just enough support to help....we all know how things can get heavy if holding them for a long time. The only problem I have with the mono unit is getting the leg to lock via the twist... I'm getting better at it, but my hands aren't all that strong any more. The tripod is easy to use! Legs and their adjustment are easy and secure with the flip logs. Everything folds down nicely and fits into a great zippered bag. It comes with a 2nd easy mount / quick release attachment...great if you want to use two different cameras..... I've only had this for less than 2 weeks, but I am pleased thus far...all in all, this tripod is a winner for me.
